## Type

- [ ] Error fix (factual correction, typo, outdated info)
- [ ] Content improvement (clearer explanation, better example)
- [ ] New content (new topic, questions, or code examples)
- [ ] Maintenance (formatting, structure, tooling)

## Checklist

- [ ] Content is accurate and up-to-date
- [ ] Explanations are concise and scannable
- [ ] Code examples use modern Python patterns (type hints, dataclasses, async/await)
- [ ] Content is provider-agnostic
- [ ] Python files pass `ruff check` and `mypy --strict` (if applicable)
